channel.title: redirect host traffic to Whonix-Gateway - Allow multiple incoming / flashproxy ports
channel.description:
I've been playing with the idea of forcing all of the host's network traffic through the Whonix Gateway. I am trying to use port forwarding so I can access the Gateway's ports from my host. Like the guide on the [wiki](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Access_Gateway_Port_From_Host).
Then I will use iptables to force all traffic through those ports. The problem is that the Whonix firewall only allows one flashproxy port. I need two. One for TCP traffic and one for DNS.
Would it be possible to add support for multiple flashproxy ports?

item.title: redirect host traffic to Whonix-Gateway - Allow multiple incoming / flashproxy ports
item.dc:creator: madaidan
item.description:
It was the post where I asked for support for multiple flashproxy ports.

Allow multiple flashproxy ports Development
I’ve been playing with the idea of forcing all of the host’s network traffic through the Whonix Gateway. I am trying to use port forwarding so I can access the Gateway’s ports from my host. Like the guide on the wiki. Then I will use iptables to force all traffic through those ports. The problem is that the Whonix firewall only allows one flashproxy port. I need two. One for TCP traffic and one for DNS. Would it be possible to add support for multiple flashproxy ports?
HulaHoop:

https://www.linuxquestions.org/questions/linux-security-4/allow-only-traffic-from-whonix-gateway-4175655650/

That person seemed to want to allow only Gateway traffic rather than force all traffic through the Gateway which can be done by allowing traffic from the libvirt group and blocking all other traffic.

Read full topic
item.source: redirect host traffic to Whonix-Gateway - Allow multiple incoming / flashproxy ports

item.title: redirect host traffic to Whonix-Gateway - Allow multiple incoming / flashproxy ports
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
@madaidan I’ve been searching for the topic where you described redirecting host traffic to the GW and blocking everything else. Can’t find it. It seems there was wider interest in the same problem and it may be interesting to have.

https://www.linuxquestions.org/questions/linux-security-4/allow-only-traffic-from-whonix-gateway-4175655650/

Let me know what tpoic this was in and I’ll move this post.

Read full topic

item.title: redirect host traffic to Whonix-Gateway - Allow multiple incoming / flashproxy ports
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
Portforwarding with libvirt possible and documented here in this script:

Aboullaite Med – 2 Dec 17

Dynamic port-forwarding for NAT-ed kvm/libvirt networks

Last week, I've wrote a post about setting up a port forwarding strategy manually on a kvm/libviert network. Today we'll automate this process taking advantage of the many cool feature of libvirt. As explained in the previous post, We want to to make...

Read full topic
item.source: redirect host traffic to Whonix-Gateway - Allow multiple incoming / flashproxy ports

item.title: redirect host traffic to Whonix-Gateway - Allow multiple incoming / flashproxy ports
item.dc:creator: madaidan
item.description:
HulaHoop:

I think this feature is fantastic and should be implemented for Whonix Desktop as an optional package.

I have no idea how to implement port forwarding for KVM or if it’s even possible which is what Whonix Host will be using. Does anyone know if it’s possible?

Read full topic
item.source: redirect host traffic to Whonix-Gateway - Allow multiple incoming / flashproxy ports

item.title: redirect host traffic to Whonix-Gateway - Allow multiple incoming / flashproxy ports
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
HulaHoop:

Yes but I meant the libvirt group on the host being somehow exempted from redirection to the GW.

Yes.

I don’t think this change can be done on the GW but on the host’s IPtables?

Indeed. This looks easy on the host but wouldn’t know how to do on the gateway.

HulaHoop:

I think this feature is fantastic and should be implemented for Whonix Desktop as an optional package.

Optional sounds good as per:

Should Whonix host be fully torified by default? Development
What are the pros and cons of either?

Optional package maybe not even needed. Could be implemented in https://github.com/Whonix/whonix-host-firewall as optional feature.

(https://github.com/Whonix/whonix-host-firewall should be merged into https://github.com/Whonix/whonix-firewall but that’s future work, do not have to be done in this thread.)

Read full topic

item.title: redirect host traffic to Whonix-Gateway - Allow multiple incoming / flashproxy ports
item.dc:creator: madaidan
item.description:
Patrick:

When you redirect DNS traffic, open this port:

EXTERNAL_UDP_OPEN_PORTS+=" 5300 "

Great! Thanks. I’ll try it out.

HulaHoop:

Do you know how to implement an exception for programs under the libvirt user group?

Yes, I should just be able to use

iptables -A OUTPUT -m owner --gid-owner "libvirt" -j ACCEPT

Read full topic

item.title: redirect host traffic to Whonix-Gateway - Allow multiple incoming / flashproxy ports
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Whonix-Gateway firewall excludes exceptions for user debian-tor and
clearnet, that is not redirected over Tor.

Read full topic
item.source: redirect host traffic to Whonix-Gateway - Allow multiple incoming / flashproxy ports

item.title: redirect host traffic to Whonix-Gateway - Allow multiple incoming / flashproxy ports
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
madaidan:

I’ve been playing with the idea of forcing all of the host’s network traffic through the Whonix Gateway.

Interesting. Do you know how to implement an exception for programs under the libvirt user group? This way you are protecting against unintentional host traffic leaks while allowing clearnet traffic from Hardened Debian VMs or other Whonix GWs without running into Tor over Tor.

Read full topic
item.source: redirect host traffic to Whonix-Gateway - Allow multiple incoming / flashproxy ports

item.title: redirect host traffic to Whonix-Gateway - Allow multiple incoming / flashproxy ports
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Patrick:

So that wouldn’t work for DnsPort .

That’s now also possible in git master.

github.com/Whonix/whonix-firewall

implement EXTERNAL_UDP_OPEN_PORTS

by adrelanos on 08:01PM - 27 May 19 UTC
changed 4 files with 20 additions and 4 deletions.

When you redirect DNS traffic, open this port:

EXTERNAL_UDP_OPEN_PORTS+=" 5300 "

Read full topic
item.source: redirect host traffic to Whonix-Gateway - Allow multiple incoming / flashproxy ports

item.title: redirect host traffic to Whonix-Gateway - Allow multiple incoming / flashproxy ports
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
On a second thought above feature isn’t ideal for two ports only. There is also:

EXTERNAL_OPEN_PORTS+=" 22 "
EXTERNAL_OPEN_PORTS+=" 80 "

But that is TCP only atm.
https://github.com/Whonix/whonix-firewall/blob/master/usr/bin/whonix-gateway-firewall#L392

 $iptables_cmd -A INPUT -i "$ext_if_item" -p tcp --dport "$local_port_to_open" -j ACCEPT

So that wouldn’t work for DnsPort.

Read full topic
item.source: redirect host traffic to Whonix-Gateway - Allow multiple incoming / flashproxy ports

item.title: redirect host traffic to Whonix-Gateway - Allow multiple incoming / flashproxy ports
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Implemented in git master just now. This should be good enough for play.

github.com/Whonix/whonix-firewall

Whonix-Gateway firewall: implement EXTERNAL_OPEN_ALL

by adrelanos on 07:39PM - 27 May 19 UTC
changed 1 files with 4 additions and 0 deletions.
github.com/Whonix/whonix-firewall

comment

by adrelanos on 07:42PM - 27 May 19 UTC
changed 1 files with 3 additions and 0 deletions.

Untested but pretty sure working. Let me know if it works for you.

Read full topic
